alert.note: Alert for Chilton; Coosa; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 11:12AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Talladega, northeastern Chilton and Coosa Counties through NOON CDT... At 1112 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lay Lake, or 9 miles south of Columbiana, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sylacauga, Clanton, Rockford, Talladega Springs, Weogufka, Stewartville, Hanover, Lyle, Pentonville, Dollar, Strickland Crossroads, Bentleyville, Marble Valley, Moriah, Speed, Fayetteville, Mitchell Lake, Lay Lake Dam, Unity and Parkdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
